evidence: With helical scanning, when you want to reconstruct an XY cross-section
To reconstruct a cross-section, say in the XY plane, you need every line integral through this section
To compensate for missing data, we perform linear interpolation between the upper and lower rays
Later improvements involved helical scanning which uses opposite rays
you could use complementary rays shot from an opposite angle to improve interpolation
